data.event: The American city was founded as Vermilionville in 1821 by Jean Mouton, a French-speaking man of Acadian descent.
In 1884, it was renamed for General Lafayette, who fought with and significantly aided the American Army during the American Revolutionary War.

event.title: was primarily based on agriculture until the 1940s

data.event: The city's economy was primarily based on agriculture until the 1940s, when the petroleum and natural gas industries became dominant.
